text:
NEW: Black women leading cities at the forefront of protests against police brutality have to take calculated approaches to address racism in a system that still downplays black women
https://t.co/bo2XO7ES4p

name: thedailybeast
text: It’s happening in Atlanta. In San Francisco. In D.C. and in Charlotte. Over and over again in recent weeks, black female mayors have stepped onto the national stage and been forced to face their contradictory roles publicly https://t.co/LcsEIRCH2u

name: thedailybeast
text: The intersectionality of being black and female puts these women in a particularly tight spot when the anti-racism demonstrations make the violence against black women something of an afterthought https://t.co/LcsEIRCH2u

name: thedailybeast
text: “I’m in charge of this city,” San Francisco Mayor London Breed told The Daily Beast, but “I’m still a black woman who is sadly still being treated in a disrespectful way as if I’m somebody’s slave” https://t.co/LcsEIRCH2u

name: thedailybeast
text: “It’s offensive,” Breed said. “All-white protesters come to my house, which they do regularly with fireworks after 11. Shooting them in the air, aiming at my window, calling me out of my name: ‘Fuck you and fuck the police. Black lives matter!’” https://t.co/LcsEIRCH2u

name: thedailybeast
text: Read more by @BLeighHoward here: https://t.co/LcsEIRCH2u
